info.name: eWay-CRM API
info.description:
## Basics

By default [https://free.eway-crm.com/31994](https://free.eway-crm.com/31994) endpoint is used for testing. See [https://github.com/eway-crm/php-lib](https://github.com/eway-crm/php-lib) for details.

To start calling methods you need to get new SID (session ID).

LogIn (Legacy) is the old user name / password (MD5) method. That will not work if you have [Azure Login](https://kb.eway-crm.com/en/documentation/2-installation/2-3-installation-the-server-part/adjust-eway-crm-web-service-for-azure-login-office-365) integration.

Instead you should rather use the new LogIn method which supports OAuth 2.0. Use Postman Authorization tab to get new token. It will work out-of box with the testing API endpoint.

If you'd like to test it with your API you need to generate ClientID / ClientSecret on your instance. Please run the following command on your eWay-CRM server database and [restart Web Service](https://kb.eway-crm.com/en/faq-1/tips/how-to-restart-eway-web-service) after it.

> EXEC dbo.eWaySP_Auth_CreateClient 'Postman', '[https://oauth.pstmn.io/v1/browser-callback'](https://oauth.pstmn.io/v1/browser-callback')  
UPDATE EWD_AuthClients SET AccessTokenLifetime = 3600 WHERE ClientName = 'Postman'  
SELECT ClientID, ClientSecret FROM EWD_AuthClients WHERE ClientName = 'Postman' 
  

The command will create OAuth client with sliding refresh token. Sliding tokens have 15 days lifetime by default. The lifetime is automatically prolonged when new AccessToken is generated.

## Return Codes

| **Return Code** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| rcSuccess | The operation was completed successfully. |
| rcGeneralError | The operation failed. Check the response description for details. |
| rcParameterError | The supplied parameter was invalid. |
| rcInternalError | Internal error while executing the request. |
| rcBaseItemChangeIdNotFound | The base change ID is no longer available in ItemChanges table. eWay-CRM keeps only the last 30 days of changes in the table. You have to manually verify all items using Get methods. |
| rcLoginFailed | Invalid credentials supplied. |
| rcBadSession | The session is no longer valid. |
| rcAccessDenied | The user does not have enough permissions. |
| rcBadAccessToken | Invalid or expired access token supplied. |
| rcOAuthRequired | Login using OAuth is requied. |

request.description: Gets base item change id (the oldest, the lowest). Available since eWay-CRM 9.1.
Queries the top 1000 contacts sorted by the count of their hub-related journal records from the biggest amount.
